message.content:
cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.SD, cs.CR, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with improving the Quality-of-Experience (QoE) for video streaming in mobile networks, which involves aspects of network infrastructure, multimedia processing, and signal processing. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also proposes a Bayesian detector that combines measurements from two Smartphone sensors to decide if a user is inside a building or not, which involves signal processing and machine learning techniques, making cs.MM (Multimedia) another likely category. Additionally, the paper proposes an HTTP adaptive streaming (HAS) algorithm, which involves multimedia processing and information theory, making cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing) and cs.IT (Information Theory) possible categories. Finally, the paper deals with the problem of coverage classification, which involves security and cryptography, making cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) a possible category as well.
